title: Vintage Travel Type
content:
Anyone know the different fonts being used in this?  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/milliemotts/2223407793/in/photostream/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/milliemotts/2223407793/in/photostream/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/milliemotts/2223407793/in/photostream/")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Screen Shot 2015-03-05 at 6.28.15 PM.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/typophile.com/files/Screen%20Shot%202015-03-05%20at%206.28.15%20PM.png) | 516.41 KB |
author: feedmartin

comments.content:
"TO SYDNEY" must be **[Grotesque MT (Extra Condensed)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Grotesque%20MT%20Std%20-%20Extra%20Condensed&fid=bb6d9705f3fbef7f120dcceb93b48368&fsize=60&text=TO%20SYDNEY&fit=1)**

"TEAL" looks modified and has no distinct letters to be sure, but it could be started as **[Benton Sans Extra Comp (Bold Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Font-Bureau%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=BentonSansExtraComp%20-%20Bold%20Italic&fid=0845128b327f05fb20b28a7db43b02fe&fsize=60&text=TEAL&fit=1)** or **[Antenna Comp (Bold Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Font-Bureau%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=AntennaComp%20-%20Bold%20Italic&fid=b1ec85aa618746f46bf400c62b34f729&fsize=60&text=TEAL&fit=1)**

The sans serif (TO SIDNEY and the smaller labels), could be various weights of Monotype Grotesque:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/grotesque-mt/")

|TEAL| could be replicated with Antenna Compressed Bold Italic:  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Antenna/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Antenna/ "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Antenna/")

Hoefler & Co.’s Numbers (Indicia) could help you replicate the sequential numbering:  
 [http://www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/ "http://www.typography.com/fonts/numbers/styles/")

PsyOps Crash Numbering is also an option:  
 [http://www.psyops.com/shop/typefaces/crash-numbering/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415104058/http:/www.psyops.com/shop/typefaces/crash-numbering/ "http://www.psyops.com/shop/typefaces/crash-numbering/")
